Recipe.title: Dutch Oven Pepper Steak
Recipe.Source: Modification from the winner of a Lodge Dutch Oven cookoff.
Recipe.Description:
Ransom is always looking for new Dutch Oven recipes. The Lodge company had annual Dutch Oven cookoffs in Utah, and one year the winner was a Pepper Steak recipe.
Of course he had to try it with his wife and a couple of friends. He followed the recipe exactly as it was published. One issue however was the large amount of "Freshly Ground Black Pepper". Everybody took turns grinding and grinding. Finally Ransom and his friend hooked a drill up to the pepper grinder and were able to finish it off in only about 10 minutes.
Guess what. The spiciness was totally out of control, to the point nobody could eat it. (We still don't know if the recipe was published incorrectly, or the cook intentionally gave the wrong recipe, or what.)
But Pepper Steak still sounded good, so we made some modifications and came up with this.

ingredient.name: Lean Beef, Cut into long thin strips

section.title: Marinade
section.instruction: In a large bowl, combine Double Strength Beef Broth, Ground Pepper, White Pepper, Chili Pepper, Paprika, Worcestershire Sauce, Tabasco Sauce, and juice from the Lime then mix well.
Slice Lean Beef into long thin strips. (≈ 1&inch; wide and ⅛&inch;-¼&inch; thick.)
Stir sliced Beef into sauce and marinate for several hours (or overnight)

section.title: Essentials
section.instruction: In a small bowl, combine Flour and Water, then mix very well until Flour is completely disolved.
Slice Onion and Bell Peppers into long strips approximately ¼&inch;-½&inch; wide.
Place Dutch Oven on medium amount of charcoals.
Remove Beef from Marinade sauce, place in Dutch Oven and brown lightly.
Add Marinade sauce and simmer until Beef is fully cooked.
Remove Beef and set aside, but leave Marinade Sauce.
Add Onion and Bell Peppers and Saut&accentedE; until barely tender.
Put Beef back into the Dutch Oven and bring to a simmer for 1 minute.
Mix Flour and Water again to ensure it is completely disolved.
While stirring contstantly, slowly add the Flour and water mixture.
Continue stirring occasionally until it comes to a boil then let simmer for 10 minutes.

Modifications.modification: If you don't want it as spicy, reduce the Ground Black Pepper and/or Tabasco Sauce. Or you can use a different hot sauce, such as Tapatio.
